laboratory_examinations.findings: Mr. A was a short, centrally obese, mildly disheveled white man with a right arm hook prosthesis. He exhibited a notable coarse, bilateral resting hand tremor and right foot tremor that decreased with intention. Initial evaluation findings included decreased sleep, racing thoughts, and expansive, irritable, and grandiose speech.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The course of Mr. A's hospitalization was marked by fluctuations in mood, with episodes of hypomania and mania observed over the years.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Mr. A inflicted wounds on himself by sticking a thumbtack in his right eyelid more than 50 times. This act was precipitated by feelings of guilt related to lustful thoughts.
